x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement:
Schools often face difficulty in maintaining transparent communication between teachers and parents. Parent–Teacher Meetings (PTMs), progress tracking, and feedback are managed through paper records or messaging apps — leading to missed meetings, communication gaps, and limited visibility into a child’s overall performance and well-being.
Administrators also struggle with tracking attendance, events, staff schedules, and feedback trends efficiently.
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.project_name: “EduCare360” — Parent–Teacher Interaction and School Management Platform
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.solution_proposal:
How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

A ServiceNow-based school engagement platform where:

  • Parents and teachers can schedule or join PTMs through the Service Portal.
  • Flow Designer automates reminders and notifications for meetings, progress updates, and reports.
  • Dashboards track attendance, academic performance, and student growth trends.
  • Virtual Agent answers parent queries such as “When is the next PTM?”, “What is my child’s attendance rate?”, or “How can I view report cards?”.
  • Admin module manages teacher schedules, classrooms, events, and feedback loops.

App Engine Studio — to create modules for meetings, student profiles, and teacher management

Flow Designer — to automate scheduling and notifications

Service Portal — for parents, teachers, and administrators

Virtual Agent — for quick, conversational access to school updates

Performance Analytics — to track academic trends and engagement data

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

Integration with Google Calendar or Outlook for PTM scheduling

Integration with school ERP or student database systems

SMS/Email API for sending automatic reminders and progress reports

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

Managing data privacy for students and parents

Ensuring adoption among schools with limited digital literacy

Handling multiple language/localization needs
